s.text: The LAT reports that despite the slowdown in prison growth, mandatory sentencing rules, "three-strikes" laws, and a growing number of parole violators have kept the growth rate from dropping as much as it might have.
Last year's growth rate, 4.8 percent, was considerably less than the decade average of 6.7 percent.

The LAT reports that despite the slowdown in prison growth, mandatory sentencing rules, "three-strikes" laws, and a growing number of parole violators have kept the growth rate from dropping as much as it might have.
Last year's growth rate, 4.8 percent, was considerably less than the decade average of 6.7 percent.

USA Today leads with a preliminary, non-public congressional study concluding that nine out of 10 background checks conducted by the Pentagon on employees with access to classified information fail to meet federal standards.
